item.title: This Place can be Beautiful Again
item.description: I sat by the river, on a damp log half-buried in mud, and watched how the yellow finger of water wound its way through the city, past gutters and factories and underneath bridges, and it smelled like the worst thing in the world. Whenever I read a poem or whatever about rivers, itâ€™s always about the beauty and majesty of nature. I bet those writers never saw a river like this one.
